casebody.data:
Joseph R. BLUMER, Personal Representative for the Estate of Joseph Blumer, Appellant,
v.
Joseph R. BLUMER, et al., Respondents. No. ED 104935 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION TWO. Filed: September 26, 2017
Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied November 13, 2017 Daniel R. Schramm, 121 Chesterfield Business Pkwy., Chesterfield, MO 63005, Robert D. Huelskamp, 296 Market St., Ste. Genevieve, MO 63670, For Plaintiff/Appellant. Jennifer M. Yarbrough, 8011 Clayton Rd. 3 rd Fl., Clayton, MO 63105, Patrick J. McCarthy, 1309 Convention Plaza, St. Louis, MO 63103, Robert C. Withington, PO Box 50351, Clayton, MO 63105, For Defendants/Respondents R. Blumer, E. Blumer & Estate of J.W. Blumer. Francis J. Elpers, Duke Nguyen, 748 Center Dr. PO Box 404, Ste. Genevieve, MO 63760, For Defendant/Respondent J.R. Blumer. Before Sherri B. Sullivan, P.J., Roy L. Richter, J., and Colleen Dolan, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Joseph Blumer appeals the trial court's judgment related to the execution of a shared real estate ownership agreement, contending that the death of James W. Blumer, a defendant at the trial court, made the judgment a nullity. Finding the trial court properly set aside the judgment as to James W. Blumer and only issued a judgment as to the remaining parties, we affirm the trial court.

No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. We have, however, provided the parties a memorandum setting forth the reasons for our decision. The judgment of the motion court is affirmed under Rule 84.16(b).
